instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.PPVRTC_G3H: What is PPVRTC_G3H? PPVRTC_G3H is a 3.3v power rail for the RTC circuit present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state. .
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H: What is PPDCIN_G3H? PPDCIN_G3H Is a power rail that comes directly from the laptop charger..
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H_ISOL: What is PPDCIN_G3H_ISOL? This is the voltage coming directly from the charger after going through a transistor. .
definitions.PPBUS_S5_HS_OTHER_ISNS: What is PPBUS_S5_HS_OTHER_ISNS? This is PPBUS_G3H after passing through a current sense resistor that splits it off from the rest of PPBUS_G3H. The purpose of this is so that we can measure how much current is flowing to this part of the machine..
definitions.U5110: What is U5110? This chip is responsible for SMC_RESET_L in many Macbook models..
definitions.SMC_RESET: What is SMC_RESET? SMC_RESET is not a signal, it is an abbreviation for “SMC_RESET_L”, which is the signal someone is referring to when they type “SMC_RESET”  "SMC_RESET_L is a signal that resets the SMC when it is low(this is what the “_L” prefix means), and lets the SMC out of reset mode when it is high. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light
threads.message:
hi

water dam

No Greenlight on the magsafe 

<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL> =>16,7V
<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> =>3,43 V
<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H_ISOL</SIGNAL> =>16,7V
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> =>8,19V
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_S5_HS_OTHER_ISNS</SIGNAL> =>8,19V
<SIGNAL>PPUS_S5_HS_OTHER_ISNS</SIGNAL> => 8,198V
<SIGNAL>PPVRTC_G3H</SIGNAL> 3,43V

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light
threads.message: Removed jtag yet? Voltage on smc reset?

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light
[SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light
threads.message: Too low, check smc reset area and pull up resistor.

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light
threads.message: Check J6100 for corrosion. <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET</SIGNAL> should be 3.4V. Check <CHIP>U5110</CHIP> and <RESISTOR>R5100</RESISTOR>, else it could be crap under SMC or dead SMC.

Smc reset voltage ok 3.4V Stable
